function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Significant correlations between travel distance and place of residence","Impact":"Misunderstanding travel behavior and preferences could lead to ineffective allocation of resources for green areas and outdoor spaces","Mitigation":"Conduct in-depth surveys and studies to understand the underlying reasons for travel preferences in different areas","Technologies":"Survey tools, data analysis software, geographical mapping tools","People":"Urban planners, policymakers, local government authorities","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies"},{"Description":"Differences in means of transportation to reach urban green spaces during the pandemic","Impact":"Inadequate infrastructure for pedestrian and bicycle travel could limit access to green spaces, potentially leading to overcrowding in certain areas","Mitigation":"Invest in pedestrian and bicycle infrastructure, promote alternative transportation methods, and implement traffic management measures","Technologies":"Transportation planning software, urban design tools, traffic simulation models","People":"Local government authorities, urban planners, community organizations","Owner":"Transportation agencies, city planning departments"},{"Description":"Changes in the type of green space visited during the pandemic containment period","Impact":"Increased pressure on popular urban parks and potential neglect of other types of green spaces, leading to uneven distribution of outdoor recreation areas","Mitigation":"Promote and develop diverse green spaces, educate the public on alternative green areas, and implement strategies to manage visitor flows","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, public outreach platforms, GIS mapping software","People":"Park management organizations, environmental NGOs, local community advocates","Owner":"Environmental agencies, local governments"}]}
